qoute: Ability may get you to the top, but it takes character to keep you there.
A character is a completely fashioned will.
A signature always reveals a man's character - and sometimes even his name.
Character builds slowly, but it can be torn down with incredible swiftness.
Action, looks, words, steps, form the alphabet by which you may spell character.
A man's own character is the arbiter of his fortune.
Character is power; it makes friends, draws patronage and support and opens the way to wealth, honor and happiness.
Character is simply habit long continued.
A single bad habit will mar an otherwise faultless character, as an ink-drop soileth the pure white page.
A man never discloses his own character so clearly as when he describes another s.
Ability may get you to the top, but it takes character to keep you there.
A character is a completely fashioned will.
A signature always reveals a man's character - and sometimes even his name.

Character is simply habit long continued.
A single bad habit will mar an otherwise faultless character, as an ink-drop soileth the pure white page.
A man never discloses his own character so clearly as when he describes another s.
Let your character be kept up the very end, just as it began, and so be consistent.
A low self-love in the parent desires that his child should repeat his character and fortune.
Character is much easier kept than recovered.
Pity the man who has a character to support - it is worse than a large family - he is silent poor indeed.
To keep your character intact you cannot stoop to filthy acts. It makes it easier to stoop the next time.
A man's character is his guardian divinity.
A man's height gives him a different outlook on his environment and so changes his character.
A man's own manner and character is what most becomes him.
A man's true character comes out when he's drunk.
A person reveals his character by nothing so clearly as the joke he resents.
Another flaw in the human character is that everybody wants to build and nobody wants to do maintenance.
Be more concerned with your character than your reputation.
Be your character what it will, it will be known; and nobody will take it upon your word.
By constant self-discipline and self-control you can develop greatness of character.
Character consists of what you do on the third and fourth tries.
Character develops itself in the stream of life.
Character in a saint means the disposition of Jesus Christ persistently manifested.
Character is a by-product; it is produced in the great manufacture of daily duty.
Character is formed in the stormy billows of the world.
Character is higher than intellect. A great soul will be strong to live as well as think.
Character is like a tree and reputation like its shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
Character is much easier kept than recovered.
Character is our destiny.
Character is power.
Character is that which reveals moral purpose, exposing the class of things a man chooses or avoids.
Character is the basis of happiness and happiness the sanction of character.
Character is the impulse reined down into steady continuance.
Character is to man what carbon is to steel.
Character is victory organized.
Character is what a man is in the dark.
Character is what you are in the dark.
Character is what you know you are, not what others think you have.
Character matters; leadership descends from character.
Character may be manifested in the great moments, but it is made in the small ones.
Character must be kept bright as well as clean.
Character, in great and little things, means carrying through what you feel able to do.
Character, not circumstances, makes the man.
Character, not circumstances, makes the man.
Commerce is of trivial import; love, faith, truth of character, the aspiration of man, these are sacred.
Courtesies of a small and trivial character are the ones which strike deepest in the grateful and appreciating heart.
Do what you know and perception is converted into character.
Dreams are the touchstones of our character.
Every human being is intended to have a character of his own; to be what no others are, and to do what no other can do.
Eyes lie if you ever look into them for the character of the person.
Faith is deliberate confidence in the character of God whose ways you may not understand at the time.
Fame is a vapor, popularity an accident, and riches take wings. Only one thing endures and that is character.
Fame is what you have taken, character is what you give. When to this truth you awaken, then you begin to live.
Good humor isn't a trait of character, it is an art which requires practice.
Good luck is the willing handmaid of a upright and energetic character, and conscientious observance of duty.
Habits change into character.
His reputation is what men say he is. That can be damaged; but reputation is for time, character is for eternity.
History is made at night. Character is what you are in the dark.
How can they expect a harvest of thought who have not had the seed time of character.
I cannot think of any character below the flatterer, except he who envies him.
I have frequently gained my first real insight into the character of parents by studying their children.
I look to a day when people will not be judged by the color of their skin, but by the content of their character.
I'm not an actress who can create a character. I play me.
I've been recognized very seldom. I think I just look different in person than I do as the character.
If a man character is to be abused there's nobody like a relative to do the business.
If a man could say nothing against a character but what he can prove, history could not be written.
If a man's character is to be abused there's nobody like a relative to do the business.
If all else fails, the character of a man can be recognized by nothing so surely as by a jest which he takes badly.
If you want to test a man's character, give him power.
In every character I play, I try to imbibe something. Every film is a learning process for me.
In words are seen the state of mind and character and disposition of the speaker.
It is a beautiful trait in the lovers character, that they think no evil of the object loved.
It is by patience and self-control that the truly heroic character is perfected.
It is in the character of very few men to honor without envy a friend who has prospered.
It is with trifles and when he is off guard that a man best reveals his character.
It's motive alone which gives character to the actions of men.

Leadership to me means duty, honor, country. It means character, and it means listening from time to time.
Luck relies on chance, labor on character.
Man's character is his fate.
Many a man's reputation would not know his character if they met on the street.
Men show their character in nothing more clearly than what they think laughable.
Moderation is an ostentatious proof of our strength of character.
Most people say that is it is the intellect which makes a great scientist. They are wrong: it is character.
Nature magically suits a man to his fortunes, by making them the fruit of his character.
Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
No author ever drew a character consistent to human nature, but he was forced to ascribe to it many inconsistencies.
No change of circumstances can repair a defect of character.
Noble character is best appreciated in those ages in which it can most readily develop.
Nothing shows a man's character more than what he laughs at.
Nothing shows a man's character more than what he laughs at.''
Obedience to lawful authority is the foundation of manly character.
Of all the properties which belong to honorable men, not one is so highly prized as that of character.
One can acquire everything in solitude - except character.
One who understands much displays a greater simplicity of character than one who understands little.
Only a man's character is the real criterion of worth.
Only men of character are trusted.
Our character is what we do when we think no one is looking.
People seem not to see that their opinion of the world is also a confession of character.
Persistence is to the character of man as carbon is to steel.
Put more trust in nobility of character than in an oath.
Reputation is what men and women think of us. Character is what God and the angels know of us.
Reputation is what men and women think of us; character is what God and angels know of us.
Self-denial is indispensable to a strong character, and the highest kind comes from a religious stock.
Show me a character whose life arouses my curiosity, and my flesh begins crawling with suspense.

Society is a masked ball, where every one hides his real character, and reveals it by hiding.

Strict punctuality is perhaps the cheapest virtue which can give force to an otherwise utterly insignificant character.

Successfully (whatever that may mean) or unsuccessfully, we all overact the part of our favorite character in fiction.

Surmounting difficulty is the crucible that forms character.
Talent develops in quiet places, character in the full current of human life.
Talent develops in tranquillity, character in the full current of human life.
Talents are best nurtured in solitude. Character is best formed in the stormy billows of the world.
That character in conversation which commonly passes for agreeable, is made up of civility and falsehood.
The character of the victim has always something to do with his or her murder.
The conspicuously wealthy turn up urging the character building values of the privation of the poor.
The difficulty with marriage is that we fall in love with a personality, but must live with a character.
The discipline of desire is the background of character.
The discipline of desire is the background of character.
The distinctive character of a child is to always live in the tangible present.
The farther behind I leave the past, the closer I am to forging my own character.
The final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.
The first thing to be done by a biographer in estimating character is to examine the stubs of his victim's check-books.
The formation of one's character ought to be everyone's chief aim.
The foundation stones for a balanced success are honesty, character, integrity, faith, love and loyalty.

There is no greater index of character so sure as the voice.

Character is the result of a system of stereotyped principals.
Character is the result of two things: Mental attitude and the way we spend our time.
If I take care of my character, my reputation will take care of me.
